intro: Phymatodes trisecta, commonly known as the three-lobed phymatode, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Phymatodes trisecta is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and dry grasslands.
